New Records: Freddie Freeman is the second player to have multiple home runs and a triple over the first two games of a World Series. The other was Babe Ruth in the 1923 World Series.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto delivered a stellar start, allowing only one hit, one earned run, two walks, and striking out four over 6 1/3 innings.
Tommy Edman, Teoscar Hernández, and Freddie Freeman all homered off Yankees starter Carlos Rodón.
Shohei Ohtani sustained a shoulder injury while attempting to steal second base in the seventh inning.
Blake Treinen struck out Anthony Volpe in the ninth inning with the go-ahead run on base, and Alex Vesia secured the final out to win the game 4-2.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts referred to Ohtani's injury as a 'little' subluxation and mentioned that early signs were positive.
The Dodgers now hold a 2-0 lead in the World Series, putting the Yankees in a must-win situation for Game 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have won 32 of 39 World Series when leading 2-0 in a best-of-7 series.
The Dodgers are favored to win the World Series with odds of -400 compared to the Yankees' +310.
